column1: The case Sarath Vs. Attorney General 2006 (3) SLR 96 too had shed light on the issue of how a dock-
statement must be evaluated, wherein, it had been held that;
“one must bear in mind that when a dock statement is considered anywhere in the judgment,
the judge who heard the evidence is aware of the prosecution case and would always consider
the dock statement while considering the prosecution story. One cannot consider the dock
statement in isolation. How can one accept or reject the dock statement without knowing the
